com.sl.algorithms.search.binarysearch

Class RecursiveBinarySearch<T extends java.lang.Comparable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sl.algorithms.search.binarysearch.RecursiveBinarySearch<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BaseInterface<T>, Constants, Search<T>

    public class RecursiveBinarySearch<T extends java.lang.Comparable>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Search<T>

    Objective: Search in a SORTED array, in Logarithmic time.

    Reference

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int findIndex(T[] sortedInput, T targetElement)

      Since we reduce the search space by half each time, the complexity must be in the order of O(log(n)).

      O(log(n)) time and space.

      Linear space complexity because of the implicit recursion stack.
